title: How to Make a Cookie Jar from a Pringles Can

steps.headline: Take an empty Pringles can.
steps.description: Wipe it clean from the inside so that there is no residue of chips left behind.

steps.headline: Paint the can any desired color.
steps.description: Preferred colors would be red, dark brown or white. Leave it to dry.

steps.headline: Take a large bowl and add 2 cups of water to it.
steps.description: Add 1 cup of white glue in it and mix well.

steps.headline: Put medium-sized tissues into the bowl of water, one by one.
steps.description: Gently take them out after they are wet with water and glue mixture.

steps.headline: Place the tissues on the can (painted and dried), such that it has lots of creases.
steps.description: This creasing effect provides a good texture.

steps.headline: Put one to two layers of tissues on the can.
After it has dried, apply a coat of the chosen paint color once again.
Take a long yarn thread and roll it around the middle of the can two to three times.
steps.description: You can add accessories of your own choice, such as small beads, sequins, tiny rhinestones, etc.

steps.headline: Place cookies in the can.
steps.description: Cover with the lid and you're done with your beautiful cookie jar!

steps.headline: Take an empty Pringles can.
steps.description: Wipe it clean from the inside so that there is no residue of chips left behind.

steps.headline: Spread the wrapping sheet on a table.
steps.description: Place the Pringles can on the wrapping paper, aligned horizontally along one side of the wrapping sheet. Apply glue to that edge and stick it to the can.

steps.headline: Wrap the sheet around the can.
steps.description: An easier way to do this is to roll the sheet around the can, just like when making edible rolls.

steps.headline: When the wrapping is complete, add glue to the other edge to fix the sheet firmly.
steps.description: Make sure you have wrapped the whole can properly and that there is no space left.

steps.headline: Cut the excess portion of wrapping sheet with scissors.
steps.description: If there is not much to cut away, simply fold the excess sheet inwards.

steps.headline: Add accessories of your own choice.
steps.description: These may be ribbons, little flowers, beads, a small note, etc.

steps.headline: Decorate the lid according to your choice.
steps.description: For a gift, you can place a large ribbon flower on the lid.

steps.headline: Add cookies to the jar.
steps.description: The cookies must be placed carefully so that they don't break.

steps.headline: Place the lid on top and your cookie jar is ready!
steps.description: Use it for yourself or gift someone else. It would be a great gift for birthday or Christmas.

text: Using Wet Tissues Take an empty Pringles can. Wipe it clean from the inside so that there is no residue of chips left behind. Paint the can any desired color. Preferred colors would be red, dark brown or white. Leave it to dry. Take a large bowl and add 2 cups of water to it. Add 1 cup of white glue in it and mix well. Put medium-sized tissues into the bowl of water, one by one. Gently take them out after they are wet with water and glue mixture. Place the tissues on the can (painted and dried), such that it has lots of creases. This creasing effect provides a good texture. Put one to two layers of tissues on the can. Then leave to dry. After it has dried, apply a coat of the chosen paint color once again. Let it dry. Take a long yarn thread and roll it around the middle of the can two to three times. You can add accessories of your own choice, such as small beads, sequins, tiny rhinestones, etc. Place cookies in the can. Cover with the lid and you're done with your beautiful cookie jar! Using Wrapping Sheet Take an empty Pringles can. Wipe it clean from the inside so that there is no residue of chips left behind. Spread the wrapping sheet on a table. Place the Pringles can on the wrapping paper, aligned horizontally along one side of the wrapping sheet. Apply glue to that edge and stick it to the can. Wrap the sheet around the can. An easier way to do this is to roll the sheet around the can, just like when making edible rolls. When the wrapping is complete, add glue to the other edge to fix the sheet firmly. Make sure you have wrapped the whole can properly and that there is no space left. Cut the excess portion of wrapping sheet with scissors. If there is not much to cut away, simply fold the excess sheet inwards. Add accessories of your own choice. These may be ribbons, little flowers, beads, a small note, etc. Decorate the lid according to your choice. For a gift, you can place a large ribbon flower on the lid. Add cookies to the jar. The cookies must be placed carefully so that they don't break. Place the lid on top and your cookie jar is ready! Use it for yourself or gift someone else. It would be a great gift for birthday or Christmas.
